name: next adjacent
title: Next Adjacent Selector ("prev + next")
desc: Selects all next elements matching "next" that are immediately preceded by a sibling "prev".

argument.desc: A selector to match the element that is next to the first selector.
argument.name: next

examples.desc: Finds all inputs that are next to a label.
examples.html:
<form>
  <label for="name">Name:</label>
  <input name="name" id="name">
  <fieldset>
    <label for="newsletter">Newsletter:</label>
    <input name="newsletter" id="newsletter">
  </fieldset>
</form>
<input name="none">

entries.longdesc: One important point to consider with both the next adjacent sibling selector (prev + next) and the general sibling selector (prev ~ siblings) is that the elements on either side of the combinator must share the same parent.
